p: From 1916 onwards, the AEF administration introduced measures to protect wildlife, including elephants and gorillas (but not chimpanzees) [ 56]. New hunting laws and permits were enacted in 1929–1930, in both AEF [ 56, 73] and Cameroon (report of the French administration of Cameroon to the League of Nations, 1930 [ 50]). Chimpanzee hunting became restricted to holders of scientific permits. Gorilla hunting became restricted to holders of either scientific or “ sportif” (touristic) permits (who were almost always European), and holders of special large game permits (which could be privileged Africans).
